treasury_media.title: Evidence of the Reduced Abundance of Proline cis Conformation in Protein Poly Proline Tracts
treasury_media.description: Proline is found in a cis conformation in proteins more often than other proteinogenic amino acids, where it influences structure and modulates function, being the focus of several high-resolution structural studies. However, until now, technical and...

treasury_media.title: Flanking Regions Determine the Structure of the Poly-Glutamine in Huntingtin through Mechanisms Common among Glutamine-Rich Human Proteins
treasury_media.description: The causative agent of Huntington's disease, the poly-Q homo-repeat in the N-terminal region of huntingtin (httex1), is flanked by a 17-residue-long fragment (N17) and a proline-rich region (PRR), which promote and inhibit the aggregation propensity of the protein, respectively, by poorly understood mechanisms...

treasury_media.title: A General Strategy to Access Structural Information at Atomic Resolution in Polyglutamine Homorepeats
treasury_media.description: The hunt is on: Huntingtin protein (htt) is the key agent of Huntington's disease, but its high‐resolution characterization has been impaired due to the presence of a long tract of consecutive glutam...

company.name: Centre de Biochimie Structurale, CNRS - INSERM - UM

profile_positions.company: Centre de Biochimie Structurale, CNRS - INSERM - UM
profile_positions.description:
-	Drove the development of a site-specific isotopic labelling strategy to study proteins by solution NMR and applied this methodology to characterise the huntingtin protein at high resolution
-	Independently designed, executed and analysed experiments
-	Routinely used biochemical and biophysical techniques to prepare and analyse protein samples
-	Established several new techniques in the lab, e.g. cell-free expression and use of fermenters
-	Designed, troubleshot and optimised bio-assays and enzymatic reactions
-	Optimised the in vitro amino acylation conditions for several in vitro transcribed tRNAs
-	Authorship and review of peer-reviewed publications
-	Successful application for two-year post-doctoral fellowship (01/2016 – 12/2017)
-	Authorship of successful proposal to access INSTRUCT cell-free platform
-	Oral presentations at international conferences (e.g. AILM2017, Grenoble & ICMRBS 2018, Dublin)
-	Lab management activities including equipment maintenance (e.g. fermenters) and  training
-	Organised regular project meetings to monitor progress and encourage brainstorming
-	Trained and supervised interns and new arrivals
-	Attended courses on small angle scattering (EMBO course) and NMR (Swedish NMR centre)
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
-	Studied recombinant hepatitis B virus (HBV) and host proteins. In-depth biochemical, structural and biophysical characterisation of HBV proteins. Interaction studies of HBV proteins with each other, human host proteins and small molecules.
-	Developed and optimised purification protocols for human chaperones and viral proteins
-	Prepared isotopically labelled proteins for NMR studies and set-up crystallisation screens
-	Biophysical characterisation of protein/protein and protein/ligand complexes
-	Reconstituted the HBV polymerase ribonucleoprotein complex in vitro to enable functional assays
-	Designed biophysical and functional assays for fragment screening (ITC, MST, 32P)
-	Used MALDI ToF MS to verify sample integrity and demonstrate successful conjugation/modification
-	Expertise in a wide range of biophysical techniques, e.g. SEC-MALS, microscale thermophoresis (MST), thermal shift assay, isothermal titration calorimetry (ITC), surface plasmon resonance (SPR)...
-	Equipment maintenance (HPLCs and ÄKTAs) and  stock management
-	Post-graduate demonstrator and tutor
-	Attended courses on animal cell culture (DCU) and bioinformatics for bench scientists (EMBO course)
profile_positions.title: PhD student

profile_positions.description: I joined the group of Dr. Helen C. Hailes and worked on the chemical synthesis of benzothiazepines to probe the calcium channel activity of annexin 5. I synthesised organic compounds and analysed intermediates and products via chromatography (column and thin layer) and NMR.
profile_positions.title: Research Internship

profile_positions.description: My project aimed to probe the site of interaction between two proteins using photo-crosslinking in combination with trypsin digestion, HPLC separation and peptide mass finger printing by MALDI-ToF MS.
profile_positions.title: Research Internship
